briefing.title: Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT
briefing.note: Lockdown Mode just shipped; we're adding it to the list of options to benchmark this quarter. Why it matters: Worth a side-by-side with what you're using now — Lockdown Mode could change the tradeoffs.

briefing.title: ClawRouter
briefing.note: Growing traction for ClawRouter on GitHub suggests rising builder interest. Why it matters: Community interest in ClawRouter is growing — check repo health before committing.

editors_note.headline: This week
editors_note.thesis: We're watching Custom Kernels for All from Codex and Claude — it's the one most likely to affect vendor and roadmap decisions this quarter.
editors_note.hook: We're flagging the lead for leadership — it's the one most likely to shift budgets or priorities.
editors_note.spotlight: The lead story is the most likely to change near-term decisions for teams shipping AI products.
editors_note.underhyped: Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT deserves more attention than it's getting.
editors_note.risk: Keep an eye on Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in — it could shift budgets or vendor assumptions.

lead_story.title: Custom Kernels for All from Codex and Claude
lead_story.what_happened: A new tool release around Custom Kernels targets gaps in current developer workflows.
lead_story.our_take: Tools are only as good as the problem they solve for you. Try it on a real task, not a tutorial.
lead_story.what_to_do: Allocate one afternoon to test Custom Kernels against your top use case.

sections.title: Builder's Bench
sections.deck: New tooling worth evaluating in an actual workflow this week.

articles.title: On Agent Frameworks and Agent Observability
articles.summary: The On Agent Frameworks paper offers techniques that applied teams should track for downstream impact (via LangChain Blog).
articles.what_happened: On Agent Frameworks adds a new option to the builder toolkit — worth a scoped evaluation.
articles.why_it_matters: The open release of On Agent Frameworks adds a viable alternative to proprietary options.
articles.what_to_do: Try On Agent Frameworks on your most common use case — measure the gap vs your current setup.
articles.our_take: Evaluate the docs and community, not just the feature list. That's what determines staying power.

sections.title: Open Source Watch
sections.deck: Repos with momentum that might deserve a deeper look.

articles.title: ClawRouter
articles.summary: The agent-native LLM router powering OpenClaw — by BlockRun. Currently at 2,429 stars with ~221 stars/day growth.
articles.what_happened: Growing traction for ClawRouter on GitHub suggests rising builder interest.
articles.why_it_matters: Community interest in ClawRouter is growing — check repo health before committing.
articles.what_to_do: Check ClawRouter for recent activity, open issues, and license compatibility this week.
articles.our_take: Popularity and production-readiness are different things. Check the last commit date and open issues first.

sections.title: Ship-It Playbooks

articles.title: Exa AI Introduces Exa Instant: A Sub-200ms Neural Search Engine Designed to Eliminate Bottlenecks for Real-Time Agentic Workflows
articles.summary: Research on Exa Instant introduces methods that could influence applied work if results hold (via MarkTechPost).
articles.what_happened: New tutorial content on Exa Instant walks through a practical implementation.
articles.why_it_matters: The Exa Instant development is a useful signal for teams shipping AI products.
articles.what_to_do: Follow the Exa Instant guide, but adapt one step to fit your actual production constraints.
articles.our_take: The value of a tutorial is the first thing you build after reading it, not the reading itself.

articles.title: Lost in the Middle: Why Bigger Context Windows Don’t Always Improve LLM Performance
articles.summary: Keep Lost on your radar — it could affect planning or tooling decisions soon (via Dev.to AI).
articles.what_happened: New tutorial content on Lost walks through a practical implementation.
articles.why_it_matters: Lost is worth a closer look for teams making near-term technology choices.
articles.what_to_do: Use the Lost guide as a template — build one thing from it this week.
articles.our_take: Adapt one proven pattern from Lost instead of copying the whole stack.

articles.title: Show HN: Busted – eBPF tool that monitors what your AI agents send
articles.summary: The Show HN paper offers techniques that applied teams should track for downstream impact (via Hacker News).
articles.what_happened: A hands-on guide to Show HN offers patterns you can adapt to your own stack.
articles.why_it_matters: Show HN is worth a closer look for teams making near-term technology choices.
articles.what_to_do: Use the Show HN guide as a template — build one thing from it this week.
articles.our_take: Use Show HN as a blueprint, then trim to fit your production constraints.

prompt_of_the_week.text: Compare these two technical approaches for [problem]. Give me a decision matrix with columns for: complexity, maintainability, performance, and team skill requirements.
prompt_of_the_week.tip: Describe both approaches briefly. Include your team size and deployment constraints.
